page.title: 05UTILITY SURVEY: REFLECTIONS.
page.content: It was decided that the results of the Utility Survey were worthy of comment as an introduction to this Survey area. This is a diverse and interesting area on the fringes of the South Manchester Suburbs. The area is almost equally divided between arable crops other than grass and intensively managed grassland as{primary land {cover category.}This latter grassland area was mostly on the fringes near woods, brooks and golf courses etc. Industry is almost non_existent and only just qualifies for recording. Urban recreational open space was also common. Only two areas merited detailed scrutiny to count amenities and some surprises emerged,such as the lack of dentists.Worth mention,yet not counted, are the railway, River Bollin and motorway which are obvious on the map yet cover little surface area.
